SSH over SOCKS5 Proxy

Jan 22, 2026 2 min read

Introduction

As we all know, sometimes, itâ€™s hard for us to connect our remote server directly or the connection is not stable, we have to conduct some method to access our remote server.

Method

Using some 3rd party application

FinalShell: We can set proxy directly

Windows

Itâ€™s not friendly to Windows

Note: on Windows, an easy option is using PuTTY/FinalShell and configuring the SOCKS5 proxy in the client settings.

Linux

We can use nc and ssh itself to proxy ssh trafic.

ssh -o "ProxyCommand=nc -x socks_proxy_host:socks_proxy_port %h %p" user@remote_host
(base) firstsnow@DESKTOP-7DDCJ5H:~/.ssh$ ssh -o "ProxyCommand=nc -x 192.161.0.101:7897 %h %p" root@xyz.xxxxx.online
The authenticity of host 'xyz.xxxxx.online (<no hostip for proxy command>)' can't be established.

This key is not known by any other names.

NOTE: If you canâ€™t access your server through proxy, that could because your proxy service banned traffic through port 22. The best way is to find and change a proxy server merchant who allow traffic through port 22.
